Thankyou to the lovely staff of Courtyard, this review is not about you however I am so upset. My partner and I stayed at Courtyard for a week, our room looked over a literal garbage tip. My partner had bali belly twice which we believed the second time was definitely from the food in the hotel as thatâ€™s the only place he ate at us I had bali belly once. It really made me reconsider whether the food is actually safe. The workers are lovely and were so welcoming so thankyou to all of you. Please if youâ€™re thinking about staying here double check the food.

TL;DR: Amazing hotelâ€¦ but it feels like the â€œamazingâ€ part is reserved mostly if you look foreign. If you blend in as local, the experience hits different â€” and not in a good way. Long version: Let me start with the good stuff, because honestly, this hotel delivers on almost everything. The facilities are gorgeous. The rooms are huge, the bed and sheets feel ultra luxe, the bathroom is spa-level, and the pool, gym, and breakfast are all 10/10. The location couldnâ€™t be better â€” literally a one-minute walk to the beach and all the trendy spots in Seminyak. With Baliâ€™s traffic, being able to skip the jams and just walk is priceless. Service on paper is solid too. They really try to anticipate your needs, and I even scored a super early check-in, which I appreciated a ton. On paper, this would have easily been 5 stars. Now for the wrinkle â€” and itâ€™s not small. For context: I look 100% local even though Iâ€™m not. In Bali, people automatically speak to me in the local language, and when I reply â€œSorry, English please? ğŸ™â€ we laugh it off. But that â€œlocal lookâ€ made a big difference here. On day one upon arrival to check in, security asked me to run my bag through their sensor and even open it up for inspection. I thought, okay maybe thatâ€™s just standard protocol. But after a few days, I noticed a pattern. On the fourth day, while I was coming back from a dance class sweaty and tired and alighting from a gojek motorcab, I was stopped again to get my bag checked. I was surprised; it was a typical Monday evening with many guests coming and going with bags and they werenâ€™t stopped by security. I became super vigilant after that that whenever I was waiting at the lobby, I would specifically observe how other guests get treated at the entrance. I saw white families breeze through with whole bags of luggage and not a request to open their bags. A few days later, after a late night out, I literally got trailed back to my room by security â€” like they had to confirm I wasnâ€™t just some random loiterer. At breakfast, Iâ€™d watch staff chat warmly with other guests â€” â€œHowâ€™s your trip? How are you enjoying Bali?â€ â€” while I got nothing beyond the basics. One or two of these things, Iâ€™d chalk up to coincidence. But over multiple days, it became clear: if you look â€œforeign,â€ you get the warm, effortless hospitality. If you look local (or Southeast Asian, like I am), you get suspicion first, service second. And thatâ€™s what stings. This isnâ€™t a budget hotel or a casual guesthouse where you kind of expect things to be hit or miss. This was a luxury stay, priced accordingly. When everyone is paying top dollar, everyone deserves to feel equally welcome. Maybe itâ€™s just a Bali thing, maybe itâ€™s a luxe-hotel in Bali thing, where local looking people are less likely to be guests, but either way it left a bad taste. As great as the facilities are, I canâ€™t see myself coming back. Edit: sort by lowest in this review section and apparently my experience isnâ€™t the first time this has happened. ğŸ¤· looks like their white-first policy has been happening for a long time. SEA guests stand up and beware!

Lovely hotel but lose 3 stars because of the 1. Restrictions on quiet lap swimming before 7am. Lap swimmers are quiet. The people yelling at them to stop and get out are not. 2. The volume of awful unrelaxing music at the poolside is just plain excruciating. If I want to listen to music at that volume Iâ€™ll go to a nightclub. And morning time is just ridiculous. Not relaxing at all. 3. Last but certainly not least, the in room phone isnâ€™t plugged in. No plug or cable. Token only. No room service from this room!

Nothing wrong with the location, room and service. But it is a very family oriented hotel. Kids started screaming around in the pool area from 8am. Really a bad idea for a romantic holiday. And the windows started to have some cracking sound when the sun hit the windows at 8am, every morning, every few seconds.

Sangat Mengecewakan. Bookingan group 45 hari sebelum nya DP 60% pelunasan 10 hari sebelum kedatangan sudah di bayar room list sementara sudah dikirim 14 hari sebelum kedatangan final roomlist 7 hari sebelum kedatangan sudah jelas time arrival request kamar dll. saat check in semua kamar dapat KING tidak ada yang twin alasannya subject to available ... OMG kalau emank ndak bisa dapat twin ndak di info dari jauh2 hari biar bisa kita jelaskan atau mereka harus nyari solusi bagaimana mengatur soal type kamar. tamu complaint dan kecewa ... sangat mengecewakan untuk hotel sekelas bintang 5

Stayed here with our kids in 2019 and surprised that they have NO SPLASH policy in pool. (Why bother having a pool if you can't have fun in it) Anyway, after the staff scolded our kids, we immediately moved hotel to M*******k Resort and Spa Jimbaran which very very kids friendly and made up the lost times. The room was nice though. Breakfast was just too crowded, the restaurant space is small. Food was okay.

I have travelled to Bali 3 times now and my last 2 trips I have stayed here & I loved it. BUT, I am beyond appalled that I recommended this resort to my family to stay at in May 2020 for the hotel to now turn around and not give me & my family a refund/credit to be used in 2021. This family trip we were taking next month was for my Grandmaâ€™s 70th birthday and she is very disappointed that she is going to lose ALL of her money now that she cannot travel this year. My grandpa has too many health complications and was advised not to travel until 2021. For such a large reputable chain of hotels, this is disgusting that you would just take someoneâ€™s money. I will never stay at a Marriott hotel again or recommend it to anyone.

2 stars for a good breakfast buffet and comfy bed. 3 taken off for: bar staff routinely leaving the alcohol out of cocktails (we watched them make it and after complaining, the manager made us proper ones) and terrible service from the restaurant and spa staff. The restaurant undercharged us for a bottle of water ($4) and we were physically barracaded from the spa as though we were trying to evade paying them??!! Completely bizarre and unacceptable behaviour. We won't return.
Got a room that had big noise from the drain, not sure what the problem was but impossible to sleep. The room was a little dirtyâ€¦I recommend selecting another hotel nearby, seems much better!

It wasn't a real pleasant stay there. Had some incidents, tried to complain to the management there, and they way they handled my complaint was even worse than the things i was complaining about! It was my first visit to bali, and i was shocked to see this level of service at the courtyard, glad i checked out and tried another local brand (maya ubud) where it was a wonderful stay with outstanding service on all the levels.
Belum layak dpt predikat hotel 5â­, tidak ada kesan mewahnya sedikitpun. Lampu kamar remang-remang, banyak nyamuk.

Would not really recommend as the room was too small, service was slow, food was not at par to that of a five star hotel, price is not worth the money though I would say one pro to staying here is the location

The room was ready and yet we were made to wait for an hour. After long, when we finally got the room, the baby's cot was not set up, even though we had specifically asked for it at the time of check-in.
Katanya bintang 5, tapi kamarnya sempit, tidak ada sofa di kamar. Tidak ada house keeping kedua di sore hari. Tidak cocok untuk bintang 5.
Lots of people, under staffed. Poor service, overpriced
False details on other booking websites..super slow service..
Rooms were cramped
Extremely over priced

Menurut saya, hotel ini terlalu berlebihan. Kami sudah menginap di empat hotel bintang 5 lainnya di Indonesia, tetapi hotel ini layak mendapat peringkat bintang tiga. Kamar 524 menghadap ke kolam renang, dan di dalamnya sangat lembap. Pencahayaan di kamar dan lorong sangat redup. Sarapan prasmanan. Minibarnya kosong melompong. Lokasinya bagus.

Menginap di hotel bintang 5 ini sungguh mengecewakan. Menurut saya, hotel ini paling banter lebih mirip hotel bintang 2. Kamar keluarga sangat kecil dan tidak cukup ruang untuk koper kami. Selain itu, kamar sangat lembap dan berbau aneh, baik di lemari pakaian maupun di seluruh ruangan. Prasmanan cukup memadai, tetapi gelas dan piring tidak dicuci dengan baik, dengan banyak jejak kotoran. Seprai hanya diganti jika diminta, jadi untuk menginap lama, tidak ada penggantian otomatis. Selimutnya terasa lembap, dan pintunya tidak mau dibuka dua kali, bahkan setelah diperbaiki. Demikian pula, lampu pintu masuk tidak menyala, bahkan setelah diperbaiki. Anak saya kehilangan topinya sehari sebelum keberangkatan kami, dan kami tidak dapat menemukannya, meskipun kemungkinan besar tertinggal di kamar. Saya langsung mengeluh setelah keberangkatan, tetapi topinya tidak dapat ditemukan. Kami memesan kamar untuk 6 malam, sejak malam pertama dan seterusnya, yang saya harapkan hanyalah dapat pergi sesegera mungkin.

Hotel yang katanya bintang lima itu pelayanannya buruk. Saya menunggu satu jam di lantai bawah. Buah-buahan dan sejenisnya tidak diperbolehkan dibawa ke kamar. Pengalamannya sungguh buruk. Baru kali ini saya mengalami pengalaman seburuk itu di Indonesia.
Tidak sebanding dengan bintang yang didapatnya

Had a subpar stay at the Courtyard. While the staff were friendly and attentive, the condition of the room was far below the expectations of a five-star Marriott hotel, and it was even worse than previous stays at Four Points or Moxy. The location was good, and a shuttle service was provided. It's also a short walk to the beach, where you can watch the beautiful Bali sunset. It looked like some parts of the hotel were under renovation. Hope the new rooms are better.

the hotel itself was an overall pleasant experience.. but, there are some very shady-looking people hanging out on the sidewalks in the morning outside the Dat Dash Club nearby.. it made my husband & i very uncomfortable to walk past them when going to and from the hotel in the morning.. many if them appeared intoxicated when they took off on their scooters, endangering the pedestrians. for the safety & comfort of future guests, maybe it would be best to look into what can be done regarding this issue.

When we first entered the resort, it was delightful to see how well-maintained and visually appealing the place is. The initial impression was positive, with vibrant surroundings and a lively atmosphere. What I Didnâ€™t Like: Unfortunately, the service fell short of expectations. During check-in, no one offered a welcome drink directly; instead, guests had to serve themselves from a corner, which felt impersonal. There were no hand towels provided, and staff did not accompany us to our room or offer a tour of the property to explain where key amenities like the restaurant were located. The resort itself felt overcrowded, with so many people around that it resembled an airport rather than a serene getaway. This detracted from the ambiance, making it unsuitable for those seeking peace and quiet. While they did provide a cake in our room, it was disappointing in taste and didnâ€™t add to the experience. Overall, I would not recommend this resort for families or couples looking for a romantic and tranquil stay. It feels more suited for travelers who enjoy a busy and bustling environment.

The room with access to the pool is spacious. Cleaning is good. Due to the constant humming from the generator, it is impossible to sleep at night, and during the day there are constant screams of children ignoring the kids club area. The hotel is for families or for large noisy groups, if you want to relax as a couple or alone - I do not recommend it. Take earplugs with you. During check-in, they did not explain anything about where the restaurant is, breakfast, or what services are available. I had to wander around the area and look for everything myself. Breakfast is chaotic, road noise and a complete lack of service. I had to be reminded 3 times for my coffee. The only thing that makes me happy here is the SPA. Great massage and friendly staff. Thank you very much. With such competition among hotels in Bali, this is a complete failure and irresponsibility. Being an elite member of Marriott hotels and having extensive experience traveling around the world, this hotel is not worth the money and 5 stars.

We recently stayed in courtyard semniyak Bali. Location and surroundings are just perfect. Many shops, eateries, spa, etc . We have been staying in Marriot hotels for two decades however this hotel staff is just average . Please donâ€™t get me wrong, the staff is ok but not to match the brand. The buffet breakfast is also average. Somehow we had bad experience with waffles, requested for crispy waffle but the stafff could not mange and got the soggy waffles. Anyway we left it as no point saying more to staff as they said â€œthis is the way we cook â€œ. Our stay was ok because of location.

Great location within walking distance to the beach. Lots of shops and restaurants in the vicinity. Spent 5 days here and breakfast appears to be the same almost everyday. Room is clean and spacious. However it can be noisy everyday 4pm onwards with the loud music by the pool. Staff overall is helpful, but friendlier to the â€˜white guestsâ€™. Staff at breakfast practically ignored having conversations with the Asians. Lots of rooms for improvement here.

Overrated in our opinion. A typical hotel set-up. Room was very nice but nothing special for the price. The pool area was nice, but you can rent villas via Airbnb for the same price or less that are just as nice or better and have private pools that donâ€™t include all the holidaying young families and drunk aussies (we were unfortunately there at the same time as a conference of some Australian start-up, which was pretty rowdy and annoying in the public areas!). The room service dinner we ordered was one of the worst meals we had had on our trip - would suggest eating out at a restaurant or one of the many local warung that are better and cheaper! The cocktails were EXTREMELY strong, which I guess is for those wanting to get hammered on holiday, but not particularly nice tasting. The buffet breakfast was impressive in terms of variety and our group said the fresh cooked food was really tasty. The pancakes, donuts, and fruit tasted a bit â€œoffâ€, guessing due to not being fresh but could also be just some preservative they use that we werenâ€™t used to the taste of. Overall, I would say stay and eat elsewhere - you can get better value for money at one of the many villas for rent in the area.

We stayed in this hotel as it was close to the airport and wanted to check the local area out. For the price point you canâ€™t go wrong. Breakfast was great value and so much selection on offer. The rooms facing the pool are nice with balcony area.

If you are expecting a 4* Marriott you will be sadly disappointed. I booked and paid in full 4 months in advance for a deluxe family room for myself and 2 adult daughters as our second hotel stay in Bali. The room was dark, very small with 2 double beds extremely close together, overlooking the street, no balcony and just a few windows. One very small single wardrobe in bathroom area where clothes would get damp from shower which was also in that area. Hardly room for 3 adults to hang their clothes for 10day stay! Furthermore room had only 2 coffee cups, 2 glasses and towels for 2. Needless to say we did not unpack. It cost me over Â£700 to upgrade to more suitable rooms. Not a good or even reasonable experience. I would not recommend Seminyak as an area where women can feel safe walking out alone at night. Even in a group of 3 after dark (bearing in mind it is dark in Seminyak at around 7pm at the latest) we were approached to buy drugs, asked to purchase endless scooter rides and also handmade jewellery and other items. Men and young children are wondering the streets pestering obvious tourists. My adult daughters were also constantly approached with inappropriate comments and questions.

The resort and hotel is compared to a high end Benidorm resort for those that live in Europe. Donâ€™t get me wrong the hotel is in a Great location with easy access to the heart of Seminyak and good access to the beach however not one I would return to. The staff are great but on a few occasions I was made to feel like a thief by the pool cafe/bar staff by wanting to escort me to my room to ensure they got a payment method because I didnâ€™t have any credit cards with me around the pool area and when I asked them to add/charge my coffee to my room bill as I do with every other Marriott that I stay in, they refused with a great fuss. The rooms are well appointed and clean and the housekeeping staff are excellent. Breakfast is a-bit hit and miss and caters more for your Indonesian breakfast foods, but ok. I would stay in this area/hotel if you are looking for a solid time of drinking and partying but I would strongly recommend alternatives in relation to resort's/hotel if thatâ€™s not your thing.

Great place to stay...... but....... To get the kids off their devices I requested to play table tennis (they have a table setup conveniently in lobby area). When I asked if the kids can play, the answer in no. Reason. They will make noise....... I explained the noise would be much less than the floor polishing machine they were working with at the time I requested (it was very loud)..... still, no response. So kids went back on their phones. Uggggg. Come on Mariott. You can still improve......

Be very careful at this location when it comes to paying for breakfast ahead of time in your package or upon arrival at the hotel. The girls (hostess') at the restaurant located on the premises will constantly harass you for money and state that you have not paid for breakfast. I don't know if they do this for extra pocket money or not, but it's pretty annoying, and will ruin your breakfast. If you've prepaid for breakfast, walk with your receipt every morning before entering the restaurant for breakfast.

My wife and two children checked in on the 19th May 2023 the hotel is in a good location and staff were nice and polite we had booked two rooms. On the 20th my daughter used the hair dryer and the electricity tripped and she went on to use the hair dryer in the second room whilst drying her hair the dryer burnt and had sparks out of fear not to get a electric shock she dropped the hair dryer in the sink which let the sink blackened. I checked in with them on the 21st May as I had some business to attend earlier and could not check in with them and they told me of the incident and I told myself that how can a five star hotel like Marriott have such equipment installed in their property which has serious health and safety requirements which could have left my daughter into a serious injury or electric shock. We were out the whole day on the 22nd for a tour and got back late in the evening around 9 pm being tired to go out decided to have a meal at the hotel restaurant. To our disappointment the food was tasteless we had ordered nasi goreng, barbecue chicken pizza, chipotle sandwich and barramundi fish. There was no barbecue chicken on the pizza and the pizza base was not fully baked nasi goreng could have been better as we tasted better nasi goreng in any warung's in Indonesia, we gave our genuine feedback to Ms Siah who was pleasant and informed the Chef. The shower floor is slippery with any no slip mat provided there is another safety hazard need attention. We are checking out on the 24th May 2023 and the reason I am writing the review is to let other guests know that be careful to use the equipment's that are provided in the property so that no one gets injured and hope the property management gets their equipment checked before any serious injury happens on the property. Best, Badhan

The staff are excellent,well trained and always happy to help , it's a very noisy environment around the pool and goes on until late at night , the breakfast is amazing however you have to walk through a smoking area before you reach the entrance ,which is not good for anyone's heath . Rooms are small but very well cleaned daily from anytime between 9 and 5pm which is sometimes not to good if you return from the beach and need access to your room Free transport to the beach is available however not to often ,the private beach area is well set back from the sea ,very tight together beds and very small ,with no refreshments available apart from water ,no bathroom facilities. If you want a quiet resort this is not the hotel to choose ,it's loud and bustling but the staff are it's only ascett in my opinion .

Rooms were nice and clean, bed very comfortable. The breakfast was pretty good, but mostly the same each day. The cocktails offered by the bar were sub par - expensive, not very alcoholic and just filled with syrups.
the design, layout, hardware, amenities nothing can relate to a 5 stars standards. Easy access to the beach, apart from that, I could not name any positive experience with this hotel.

It's a good property and clean property. But they probably operate with less staff during the covid. Make up room not done when we reach back hotel for rest at 3:30 pm. Have to ask several times and they come. Parking not connected with the building, and we have to walk by the roadside to the basement parking. And the security at the lobby said we have to open our luggage and take out the small scissor since the hotel issued the rules that guest not allow to bring scissor??

Good hotel but the tv turning on every time walking in the room and no near reach light switch for the bathroom etc. I enjoyed my stay the breakfast was 7/10 kinda all tasted the same, enjoyed the bagels and the fresh fruit and the complimentary coffee/tea that wasnâ€™t powder was great. Service at the bar could have been faster many times had to wait 40 minutes for a milkshake but the cocktails were delicious

Hotel is ok . Booked this hotel based on reviews and i was disappointed. Rooms are clean at first glance but then you realise the lack of hydiene throughout the whole hotel . Toilets next to the kids club smelt like urine every day . Had a bill from the pool bar which they claim we didnt pay when we did. Management pretty much did nothing and we were left with paying the same bill twice. Our mistake for not keeping the receipt. We paid all our bills straight away not leaving anything for checkout so we were pretty shocked when we were presented with another bill . Had to ask reception every day to clean our room because by 3-4pm it was still not done . Staff are friendly, but just dont expect too much from other than a smile. Definitely won't be staying here again .

The pool bar staff need some tuition in how to serve customers at a five star hotel! Cocktails should be served on a tray not passed across because she's too lazy to walk up the steps! If you pay the price for the drinks, you need the service appropriate to that! Sure it's Bali but I wouldn't pay extra to stay here!
The hotel is clean and the front desk staffs are very nice and friendly. However, the room housekeeping service is below satisfaction where no refill for coffee bar.

Tolong pelayanan lebih profesional. Bintang 5 masih bagusan guest house. Saya datang ternyata pintu kamar gak bisa dibuka harus diganti batere. Udah capek2 malam badan kotor masih harus nunggu lagi pintu diperbaiki. Ampass.
Rooms are small but clean. some of the pool staff were unfriendly and not at all attentive.
Spacious rooms, although outdated. Gorgeous pool area. Gougeous restaurant, but needing a good cleaning, chairs and couches really durty. Food OK. Very friendly staff
This hotel is a decent and clean place to stay in Seminyak. Itâ€™s crowded and touristy so donâ€™t come here if youâ€™re seeking an authentic Bali experience.

I like this hotel location breakfasts and pool..I booked and stayed in the pool access king suite..it is very expensive and the suite is small..I would stay here again but not at that very expensive price...can get other 4.5 star hotels that offer the same with bigger suites..I waa alsi shocked a purchase a bottle of muscato wine in Australia that bottle customers 34 dollars here waa 82 dollars..also the price that is on the menu is not the full price they add the tax and other charges when you go to pay for it..si be in for a shock when your purchase food and drinks.. the staff are nice but it is the price is the killer for this hotel
This place is located just few metres away from Seminyak beach. Lets just say its one big hotel offering luxurious facilities. Good for families.

I stayed for two nights on christmas day, i request a quiet room but turned out to be given a room near a noisy street and busy with the sound of car and motorcycle. Ac broke down for two nights I could not sleep well.
Extremely chaotic check in experience, very average rooms for the high price point.
Not a bad stay but air con is a little noisy and cost seem to be cut in place they don't think you care about (like single ply ultra thin toilet paper)
Average everything about this place. Pool area is nice, but overall not worth it, price quality ratio
Very noisy at early night from the loud music and due to the traffic But in general fair for price
Clean rooms with courteous staffâ€¦you get more than you pay for. Oh, the breakfast buffet is GOOD
Nginap 4 malam, Security helpfull, kamar bagus, suara dari kamar sebelah mengganggu waktu istirahat
Nothing luxurious about the hotel. But customer service is excellent.

Review Text: security guard need more polite . they open my back door car and slam my door . ğŸ˜¥ â€¦
Heaps of bogans here, Seminyak is now like mini Kuta I wouldn't stay in Seminyak again
Just been there for a drink to meet friends. Bar is not comfortable at all.
Hotel berbintang 4-5 di kawasan padat area seminyak.
Lokasinya di tempat wisata, namun kekurangannya adalah tidak disediakan musholla
Near beach hotel... Staff is friendly according the Marriott standard
the room is good.. the food is NOT..
